content.description: Walk out onto little ledge, smear up rolling slabs following bolts until you reach the diagonal crack going up to the left with scooping feet. The farther left you go the less footing you have. Follow the crack up to the crux, bouldery move to the right. Seems easier for taller people. Runout at the top to the anchor. Alternate line is to skip the crack and go straight up through big moves to jugs.
content.protection: 5-6 fixed bolts bellow crux, would carry a medium cam to protect diagonal crack below crux. Runout above crux to the anchor. 2 bolt anchor.
content.location:
Left of Heart Throb.

Small trail runs back around to the bottom.

content.description: Start is the same as Dike's Edge.  Climb the vertical dike and move right at the gully onto friction climbing past a couple of bolts.
content.location: Second route from the far right of the rock, just left of Sinister Footwear. Shares a start with Dikes Edge. Scramble up and walk off of the top.

content.description: Walk to the far right side of the face and scramble up onto a small ledge to begin.  The crux is right in your face off the deck. Follow the hard face climbing past a couple bolts and move into the seam (1 inch piece useful).
content.protection: Gear (larger cams useful for the anchor) and a few bolts.
content.location: Farthest right route on the rock.

content.description: Starts at a short diagonal crack, followed by a slab section and a small bulge. Ends with a runout but easier section (may take gear but it is not necessary). Can be set up as a toprope, but not without significant rope drag.
content.protection: 5 bolts + 2 bolt anchor with rap rings. Can use a #3 BD cam and a red tricam to protect the runouts. I think maybe a #1 to protect the runout to the anchors.
content.location: Farthest left route. Left of Push It Along and Conjunction Junction. Short diagonal crack marks the start.

content.description: Small log platform makes for a decent landing. Start on a low rail and climb a 5 ft offwidth section. Find the undercling pocket and enjoy the stem to finish. Crazy varied and fun.
content.protection: 3-4 pads. Could go on one or two pieces of protection.
content.location: Climb is located in a large cluster of boulders to the west of the main crag. Follow the cliff to the furthest righthand routes. Approximatley 5 to 10 minute hike from that point begins the area of new boulders. Located in the tall boulder cave.

content.description: The first part of the climb is sustained 5.9 moves with crimpy edges and decent feet. The climb transitions to easier slab terrain after the first 30 feet.
content.protection: 5 bolts + 2 bolt anchor. Shares anchor with Conjunction Junction. Gear after the second bolt can protect a brief runout. Offset cam .5/.75.
content.location: This climb starts on an alcove next to a large pine tree. It is on the upper section of the rock formation.

content.description: Climb past two bolts to a short crack that protects okay with hand size gear. Continue up past rolling slab past bolts to a diagonal crack. Follow the crack and step right to seam when feasible then exit past large pocket above into sandy scoop in the rock to two bolt anchor.
content.protection: 5 bolts, gear to 3 inches, tricams for pockets, 2 bolt anchor. Can easily TR with 70m rope. 60m rope you'll have to belay from uphill a bit.
content.location: Bolted line to the left of Dike's Edge and to the right of the steeper bolted line Yahtzee.

content.description: Start on the obvious dike and climb onto the face above. After the 3rd bolt, step left and continue upward. You may be tempted to go right at some point. Stay left to the anchors. Would be a good first lead.
content.protection: 10 bolts, two bolt anchor. Scramble up the easy 3rd and walk off.
content.location: 2nd route from the far right side of the rock, starting on a prominent dike. Shares start with Temperature Rising.

content.description: First crux is at the steep slab, second crux is getting over the bulgy roof.
content.protection: 4 bolts + 2 bolt anchor. Good gear can protect the runouts. Shares anchor with Push it Along
content.location: The route starts to the left of Push It Along (Push It Along is on an alcove with a large pine tee). It goes up a steep slab to a bulgy roof. The bolt above the roof is hard to see.
